newsitem.title: UK: Photocopiers can cause lung disease -- study.
newsitem.headline: Photocopiers can cause lung disease -- study.

text.p: Photocopier dust can cause serious lung disease, Austrian doctors said on Friday.
Christine Armbruster and colleagues at the University of Vienna described the case of a man who evidently developed two conditions from the tiny metal particles in photocopier toner.

In a letter to the Lancet medical journal, they said a 39-year-old man who did not smoke had suffered a persistent dry cough for a year. He was diagnosed with granulomatous pneumonitis, caused by breathing in tiny particles of metal, and lymphadenopathy -- a swelling of the lymph glands. "With increasing use of photocopiers, more patients with pulmonary disease due to exposure to toner dust are expected," they wrote.
Two years ago Spanish doctors wrote to the Lancet about a 44-year-old woman who suffered another lung disease, siderosilicosis, from working in a photocopying shop.
